edu.kit.aifb.concept.index
Interface ICVIndexBuilder

All Known Implementing Classes:
IndexedFileCVIndexBuilder
public interface ICVIndexBuilder

An concept vector index is an inverted index of a set of concept vector. This is an interface for classes that build such a CV index.

Author:
pso

Method Summary
 void add(IConceptVector cv)
          Add an concept vector to the index.
 void buildIndex()
          This actually builds the complete index.
 boolean indexExists()
          Checks if the index already exists.
 void initialize(java.lang.String id, int conceptCount)
           
 

Method Detail

add

void add(IConceptVector cv)
Add an concept vector to the index. This function has to be called for each CV before buildIndex() is called.

Parameters:
cv - The concept vector that should be added.

buildIndex

void buildIndex()
This actually builds the complete index. The index will contain all concept vectors that have been added using the add() function.

indexExists

boolean indexExists()
Checks if the index already exists. This can be used to avoid a recreation of an existing index.

Returns:
True if the index exists already.

initialize

void initialize(java.lang.String id,
                int conceptCount)
